unit.comment: /*------------------------------------------------------------------------- * PX Notice receiver support * * When a PX process emits a NOTICE (or WARNING, INFO, etc.) message, it * needs to be delivered to the user. To do that, we install a libpq Notice * receiver callback to every QC->PX connection. * *------------------------------------------------------------------------- */

/* * libpq Notice receiver callback. * * NB: This is a callback, so we are very limited in what we can do. In * particular, we must not call ereport() or elog(), which might longjmp() * out of the callback. Libpq might get confused by that. That also means * that we cannot call palloc()! * * A PXNotice struct is created for each incoming Notice, and put in a * queue for later processing. The PXNotices are allocatd with good old * malloc()! */

function.name: MPPnoticeReceiver
